alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 8:56PM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Ice accumulations of one tenth to four tenths of an inch and total snow accumulations of up to one inch possible. * WHERE...In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ice accumulation currently lingering on trees, powerlines, untreated roads and untreated sidewalks will not have a chance to melt prior to the onset of the next round of freezing rain expected Saturday afternoon into Sunday afternoon. As a result, any amount of additional ice accumulation will further increase the risk of downed trees and powerlines. Travel impacts will continue along portions of I-84 and SR14 as well.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
